intro: Gomphrena minutissima, commonly known as the dwarf globemallow, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often resembling tiny globes. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in dry, sandy soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Gomphrena minutissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a drought-tolerant plant.
